articles.author: Negitama
articles.description:
I wish I knew this before approaching Database Access in Python with SQLAlchemy

Below is an in-depth example that shows two approaches in Python using SQLAlchemy: one that leverages the ORM ("bit-ORM layer") and one that uses raw SQL queries ("bit-out-ORM layer"). In the example, we define a simple model for job descriptions and then provide two repository functions that return job descriptions for a given company. At the end, I discuss the advantages and disadvantages of each approach.

## 1. Setup: Define Models with SQLAlchemy ORM

First, we create our ORM models. This file (e.g., orm_models.py) defines the schema in code using SQLAlchemy‚Äôs declarative base.




python
from sqlalchemy import Column, Integer, String, Text, create_engine
from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import de‚Ä¶

articles.author: Negitama
articles.description:
Did you know‚Ä¶ In Python, there are two powerful ways to interact with databases using SQLAlchemy: the ORM layer and raw SQL queries. Here‚Äôs a deep dive into both approaches and when to use each.

# Setup: Define Models with SQLAlchemy ORM
First, we create our ORM models. This file (e.g., orm_models.py) defines the schema in code using SQLAlchemy‚Äôs declarative base.


python
from sqlalchemy import Column, Integer, String, Text, create_engine
from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import declarative_base
from sqlalchemy.orm import sessionmaker

# Base class for our ORM models
Base = declarative_base()

class JobDescription(Base):
    __tablename__ = 'job_description'
    id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True)
    company_id = Column(String, nullable=False)
    company_name = Column‚Ä¶
articles.title: Did you know the two powerful ways in Python to interact with databases?

articles.author: bilel salem
articles.description:
Injecting interfaces instead of concrete classes in NestJS constructors (or any DI-based architecture) promotes decoupling, flexibility, and testability. However, because interfaces don't exist at runtime in TypeScript/JavaScript, this approach has practical limitations and requires additional setup (like useClass, useExisting, or useFactory).
Loose Coupling




Problem: Injecting concrete classes tightly couples your service to a specific implementation.
Benefit: Injecting an interface allows you to depend on a contract, not a specific implementation.
Example:




  constructor(private readonly userService: IUserService) {}

Improved Testability



You can easily mock implementations in tests by providing a test-specific class or object.
Example:




  providers: [
    {
      provide: IU‚Ä¶
articles.title: Why You Should Inject Interfaces, Not Classes, in NestJS Applications ?

    job_description = Column(Text, nullable=False)

articles.author: BiKodes
articles.description:
Whether you're a developer, a student, or just curious about the command line, these basic Bash and Shell commands will help you navigate and manage files more efficiently.

1. It‚Äôs recommended to add a space between commands and symbols, e.g.,cd .., not cd...
2. Some commands might not work in Windows PowerShell but will function in the Git Bash terminal, and vice versa. Always test in your preferred setup terminal.
ls

Lists all files and folders in the current directory.
ls <folder_name>

Displays all contents inside a specific folder.
cd ..

Moves up to the parent directory.
cd <folder_name>

Navigates to a specific folder. Use quotes if the folder name contains spaces, e.g.,  cd "My Documents".
pwd

Prints the current working directory path.
start . (Windows) or open . (Mac)

Opens th‚Ä¶
articles.title: Essential Bash/Shell Commands for Beginners

articles.author: Negitama
articles.description:
Ever wondered about the best way to work with databases in Python? In this post, I've explored two different approaches using SQLAlchemy: the ORM layer and using raw SQL.
1. Setup: Define Models with SQLAlchemy ORM
JobDescription model and a CandidateResume model.
2. Bit-ORM Layer: Repository Using the ORM
Advantages of the ORM Approach
Abstraction & Simplicity: Deal with Python objects and let the ORM handle SQL.
Maintainability and Safety: Model changes update underlying queries and prevent SQL injection.
3. Bit-Out-ORM Layer: Repository Using Raw SQL
Advantages of the Raw SQL Approach
Fine-Grained Control: Write optimized SQL for complex tasks.
Transparency & Flexibility: See the exact SQL sent and use database-specific features.
Summary and Comparison
Consider using an ORM for regular tasks and raw SQL for fine-tuned, performance-critical queries. This hybrid approach provides productivity with control when needed.
articles.title: Two Approaches to Database Interaction with SQLAlchemy in Python

articles.author: Negitama
articles.description:
SpannerDB Reading Capabilities and Transaction Specifications

SpannerDB (Google Cloud Spanner) provides sophisticated reading capabilities designed to balance consistency, performance, and global scale. This report explores the comprehensive read transaction specifications of SpannerDB, examining its various transaction types, consistency guarantees, and implementation details.

## Core Read Transaction Types

Google Spanner offers several distinct reading capabilities that serve different application needs while maintaining strong consistency guarantees across a globally distributed database.
articles.title: SpannerDB Reading Capabilities and Transaction Specifications
